Readings

Published

Feb 17, 2025

Note: The password for all password protected content is on Piazza

Week 1: Introduction to Health Geography and GIS

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Introduction and Chapter 1

Week 2: Introduction to Spatial Data; Projections and Coordinate Systems

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 2
  • O’Sullivan, D., & Unwin, D. J. (2010). Geographic Information Analysis (2nd ed.). Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Chapter 1

Week 3: Spatial Data for Public Health; Making Data Mappable

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 3

Week 4: Geocoding and Joins

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 3

Week 5: Mapping Health Information; Map Design

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 4
  • Koch, T. (2005). Cartographies Of Disease: Maps, Mapping, And Medicine. Redlands, CA: ESRI Press. Chapter 1

Basic GIS Operations

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 5

Pattern and Process; Spatial Neighbors

  • O’Sullivan, D., & Unwin, D. J. (2010). Geographic Information Analysis (2nd ed.). Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley & Sons, Inc., Chapter 4

Disease Clusters; Grouping and Regionalization; Applied Autocorrelation/Clustering/Grouping

  • Sabel, C. E., & Loytonen, M. (2004). Clustering of Disease. In R. Maheswaran & M. Craglia (Eds.), GIS in Public Health Practice (pp. 51–67). CRC Press.

  • Omer, S. B., Enger, K. S., Moulton, L. H., Halsey, N. A., Stokley, S., & Salmon, D. A. (2008). Geographic Clustering of Nonmedical Exemptions to School Immunization Requirements and Associations With Geographic Clustering of Pertussis. American Journal of Epidemiology, 168(12), 1389–1396.

  • Delamater, P.L., Leslie, T.F., Yang, Y.T., 2018. Examining the spatiotemporal evolution of vaccine refusal: nonmedical exemptions from vaccination in California, 2000–2013. BMC Public Health 18, 1–13.

Environmental Hazards; Spatial Interpolation

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 6

Disease Risk and Diffusion; Ecology of Disease

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapters 7 and 8

Spatial Regression Techniques; Temporal Analysis and Change Detection

  • Sparks, P. J., & Sparks, C. S. (2010). An application of spatially autoregressive models to the study of US county mortality rates. Population, Space and Place, 16(6), 465–481.

Neighborhoods and Health

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 11

  • Diez Roux, A. V. (2001). Investigating Neighborhood and Area Effects on Health. American Journal of Public Health, 91(11), 1783–1789.

Access to Health Care; Network Analysis; Spatial Interaction Models

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 9

  • Delamater, P. L., Messina, J. P., Shortridge, A. M., & Grady, S. C. (2012). Measuring geographic access to health care: raster and network-based methods. International Journal of Health Geographics, 11(15), 1–18.

  • Delamater, P. L. (2013). Spatial accessibility in suboptimally configured health care systems: A modified two-step floating catchment area (M2SFCA) metric. Health & Place, 24, 30–43.

Health Care Utilization; Locating Health Care Services

  • Cromley, E. K., & McLafferty, S. L. (2012). GIS and public health (2nd ed.). New York: Guilford Press. Chapter 10
